Hi Chris, Oliver Coleman also wrote an undergraduate honors thesis on usi=
ng HyperNEAT in perception-type problems.  It's called "Evolving Neural Net=
works for Visual Processing," and we've made a copy of it available from ou=
r server:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/coleman_ugradthesis10.pdf



--- =
In neat@yahoogroups.com, "garrerc52" <garrerc52@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks, Col=
in.  I had completely forgotten about the initial "boxes" experiment!  I'll=
 look up the paper you're referring to as well.
> 
> I'm getting spun up on=
 Hierarchical Temporal Memory at the moment.  It's been around for a couple=
 of years, but it's relatively new to me.  I'll have a look at DBNs as well=
 for future use.  I heard of them, but I'm not familiar with them, either. =
 I'm starting to wonder if one or both of HTMs or DBNs could benefit from C=
PPNs.  As long as they can be mapped to a substrate and there's some spatio=
-temporal patterns in the data, I would certainly think so.
> 
> 
> -- Chri=
s
> 
>

ng between two

t to
